page.title: 14CAMBERLOT HALL - A STORY
page.content: On July 21st 1944, on a combat mission to Oberpfaffenhofen in Germany, an airman of the 392nd Bomb Group of the United States Airforce was in trouble ! His Liberator was badly flak damaged over the target and was managing to limp back to the English coastline and was desparate to land. The Lieutenant found a runway and this was later (30th April 1984) to be established as Deanland airfield. The aircraft had to land without permission on a small fighter field under construction with labourers laying perforated steel planking. As the plane landed a landing strut broke off and the aircraft groundlooped at over 100mph and one of the wings sliced through the conrol tower. The aircraft stopped just before a downhill slope into a gully ! For this the pilot was awarded the Â£Silver Star'.
